title: Building Trap Channelization
brief: Create funnel-shaped barriers to guide animals directly into traps.
steps: Step 1: Build a funnel-shaped barrier extending from both sides of the animal trail toward the trap.
Step 2: Make the narrowest part of the funnel nearest to the trap location.
Step 3: Reduce the trail width to just slightly wider than the target animal's body.
Step 4: Maintain this narrow constriction for at least one animal body length back from the trap.
Step 5: Begin widening toward the mouth of the funnel beyond this point.
Step 6: Make barriers inconspicuous but inconvenient to go over or through - they don't need to be impassable.
warnings: Channelization must look natural or animals will become suspicious.
Wild animals rarely back up - they prefer to continue forward into traps.
Barriers that are too obvious will alert prey and cause avoidance.
